page.title: 10CHILDREN'S PARTY, HIGH HAM
page.content: There has been an annual children's party in High Ham village hall for about 40 years. Originally this was organised as a Christmas party by the British Legion and held the first Saturday in January with Father Christmas attending. Later the Women's Institute joined the British Legion in putting on this party. Nowadays it is organised by the village with money donated by both these organisations. It is no longer a Christmas party, as this is such a busy time of the year, but has been moved to February,thought to be a dull month after all the excitement of Christmas and the New Year. It is for all children up to the age of 16 living in the parish. A party tea is laid on, with games and an entertainment, such as a conjurer. Staff from the village school and the Vicar also attend.
